body: I observe similar behavior if when using GUI I do not fill `Override Host` field

Just digging a bit more into OpenAPI - it says :
```
If host is not specified, it is assumed to be the same host where the API documentation is being served.
```
https://swagger.io/docs/specification/2-0/api-host-and-base-path/

However it seems that zap-extension for OpenAPI assumes that host must be there
It looks like https://github.com/zaproxy/zap-extensions/pull/905 this commit added HostOverride - so it is relevant... could it be that host override is not exposed via `zap-api-scan.py`?

Yes, that's not yet exposed through the script.

We also need to fix the issue in the OpenAPI add-on, which should default to host of the URL.

I was trying to find OpenApi addon source code but only found Jar file on GitHub repo.
I donâ€™t mind creating s Pull Request to either expose Host parameter on the script or to fix addon

The source of the add-on is in the alpha branch:
https://github.com/zaproxy/zap-extensions/tree/alpha/src/org/zaproxy/zap/extension/openapi

FYI, I already have the changes in place, still checking everything is correct but should be ready today.

issue.title: OpenAPI add-on should fallback to host of URI

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
From #4269.

Same as with scheme (#3433), if the host is not specified in the definition it should be used the host of the requested URI.

Add-on
OpenAPI Support, version 9 (and older).

issue.title: Allow to override the host in Docker OpenAPI scans

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
Change zap-api-scan.py to allow to specify the host to override the one
in the remote OpenAPI specification.

Fix #4269 - Zap2Docker API scan - how to pass override Host parameter

body:
@thc202 thank you for fixing that
I have a similar problem, but I'm using yaml file with swagger spec. I need to override host in that yaml file from cmd. Option `-O` is applicable to `target_url` case, not `target_file`
I also tried to use `-z "-config formhandler.fields.field\(0\).fieldId=host -config formhandler.fields.field\(0\).value=my_host.net -config formhandler.fields.field\(0\).enabled=true"` but it doesn't seem to be working
Could someone nudge me to the right direction?
Thanks in advance
This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
